name: Brahma Kumaris World Spiritual University
goal:
Brahma Kumaris is a worldwide network of organisations dedicated to personal transformation and world renewal. Founded in India in 1937, Brahma Kumaris as an network of organisations has spread to over 110 countries on all continents and has had an extensive impact in many sectors as an international NGO. Its real commitment is to helping individuals transform their perspective of the world from material to spiritual. It supports the cultivation of a deep collective consciousness of peace and of the individual dignity of each person.
The spiritual headquarters of Brahma Kumaris is in Mount Abu, India. At a national level, activities are co-ordinated by local people in alignment with the spiritual principles of Brahma Kumaris, working in accordance with the laws of the land. Activities of international interest are co-ordinated regionally from offices in London, Moscow, Nairobi, New York and Sydney.
Brahma Kumaris offer courses in Mediation to better understand and practice inner strengths and values. Other courses encourage spirituality in daily living and include positive thinking, anger management, stress relief and self-esteem. These are also brought into healthcare, social work, prisons and other community settings.
Brahma Kumaris contributes to inter-religious activities worldwide by focusing on the spiritual dimension of dialogue.
All activities of the Brahma Kumaris are offered free of charge and supported by local teachers and students.
interests: Climate Action, Culture, Education and training, Environment, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Youth
